content.description: Placeholder name as FA is unknown.  This route looks like a walk up, but turns out to be....Sneaky Tough.

Fun multipitch route with steep, airy climbing. Can be wet in early season. First pitch 10d, second 10c/d, third 10a/b. The end of the second pitch is powerful and contrived, and can easily be climbed around at 5.6 R. The 5.10a/b crux on the 3rd pitch is a bit spicy!
content.protection: Lots of bolts (12 or 14 on first pitch I think?), bolted anchors, and an intermediate rap anchor to allow 3 raps with a single 60m rope (watch rope ends!).
content.location: See red line in area photo.

content.description: Start out climbing up an easy ramp to the first bolt. Reach up to a very large hueco jug in the overlap/small roof and clip the second bolt. Begin the first of the difficulties on this route with some long reaches to better holds (harder if shorter). Get situated to the left in the dihedral, moving up and clipping a few more bolts to get to a good foot ledge. From the foot ledge, enter the crux by stemming in the smooth dihedral with worse hand holds than you'd probably like. Make a tough clip and exit the dihedral up and slightly right to a good ledge hold (or go straight up to the next bolt, which is certainly harder). From here the route merges with the Beckoning. Finish the top third to that route to the same anchors.
content.protection: 9 bolts to chain anchors shared with "The Beckoning"
content.location: This route starts left of the large corner with a flat face on the left. There is a very large hueco jug in the slight overlap/roof between the first and second bolt.

content.description: Start up a slight corner, pulling the shallow roof at the first bolt. Stem and crimp your way up the face to the left of the corner, making a few committing moves between the bolts. Plenty of good holds and clipping stances but expect to make moves above your bolt on this one.
content.location: This route climbs the large flat face the forms the left side of somewhat of a corner on the left side of the Imagination Wall. It is about 50 feet past the large bulge in the wall that you have to walk around to get to the left side of the Imagination Wall.

content.description: Left side of the wall, newer routes.
